Package me.ahoo.cosid.cosid

Interface CosIdGenerator

All Superinterfaces:
IdGenerator, Statistical, StringIdGenerator
All Known Implementing Classes:
ClockSyncCosIdGenerator, FriendlyCosIdGenerator, Radix36CosIdGenerator, Radix62CosIdGenerator, RadixCosIdGenerator
public interface CosIdGenerator extends IdGenerator
CosId algorithm ID generator.

This interface implements the CosId algorithm, a distributed ID generation approach that combines timestamp, machine ID, and sequence information in a flexible format. Unlike traditional algorithms like Snowflake, CosId uses a state-based approach that can be serialized to and from string representations.

Key features of the CosId algorithm:

  • State-based design with explicit timestamp, machine ID, and sequence components
  • Flexible string representation using CosIdIdStateParser
  • Support for different radix encodings (62, 36, etc.)
  • Human-readable and sortable ID formats

The CosId algorithm works by:

  1. Maintaining state information about the last generated ID
  2. Generating new IDs as CosIdState objects containing all components
  3. Converting states to string format using a CosIdIdStateParser

  • Method Details

    • getMachineId

      int getMachineId()
      Get the machine ID assigned to this generator.

      This is the unique identifier for the machine or instance that is generating IDs, which ensures global uniqueness across the distributed system.

      Returns:
      The machine ID

    • getLastTimestamp

      long getLastTimestamp()
      Get the timestamp of the last ID that was generated.

      This is used for clock synchronization and to ensure proper ordering of generated IDs. It can also help detect clock drift.

      Returns:
      The timestamp of the last generated ID

    • getStateParser

      @Nonnull CosIdIdStateParser getStateParser()
      Get the state parser used to convert between ID states and string representations.

      The state parser is responsible for serializing CosIdState objects to string format and deserializing strings back to states. Different parsers can be used to create different string formats.

      Returns:
      The state parser for this generator

    • idConverter

      @Nonnull default IdConverter idConverter()
      Get the ID converter (unsupported in CosIdGenerator).

      CosIdGenerator does not support the traditional IdConverter approach because it uses a state-based design with explicit CosIdIdStateParser for string conversion. This method always throws UnsupportedOperationException.

      Specified by:
      idConverter in interface IdGenerator
      Returns:
      Never returns (always throws exception)
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - always thrown because CosIdGenerator uses state parsers instead

    • generate

      default long generate()
      Generate an ID as a long value (unsupported in CosIdGenerator).

      CosIdGenerator does not support generating simple long IDs because it uses a state-based approach that includes structured information. This method always throws UnsupportedOperationException.

      Specified by:
      generate in interface IdGenerator
      Returns:
      Never returns (always throws exception)
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - always thrown because CosIdGenerator uses state-based generation

    • generateAsState

      @Nonnull CosIdState generateAsState()
      Generate an ID as a state object.

      This method generates a new ID as a CosIdState object containing all the components (timestamp, machine ID, sequence) that make up the ID. The state can then be converted to string format using the state parser.

      Returns:
      The generated ID as a state object

    • generateAsString

      @Nonnull default String generateAsString()
      Generate an ID as a string value.

      This method generates a new ID by first creating a CosIdState and then converting it to string format using the configured getStateParser().

      Specified by:
      generateAsString in interface IdGenerator
      Specified by:
      generateAsString in interface StringIdGenerator
      Returns:
      The generated ID as a string value

    • stat

      default IdGeneratorStat stat()
      Get statistical information about this CosId generator.

      This method provides detailed information about the generator's configuration and current state, including machine ID and timestamp information.

      Specified by:
      stat in interface IdGenerator
      Specified by:
      stat in interface Statistical
      Returns:
      Statistical information about this CosId generator
